title: Why is silver so toxic?
body: Wayyyy more often than not, at least every three in five games I have at least two flamers or an afk or a troll. And people tell me "well if you get a bad team then go take a break ffs" but if I did that then I'd be playing a game, taking a break because of toxics, playing a game, taking a break because of toxics, and that's just not what you wanna' have to do in the holidays because that's just sad.

replies.body:
^ this x1000. League is just one big toxic game regardless of the elo. Hell you even see challengers streaming flaming one another.

Don't expect it to get any better once you hit gold etc either. It actually gets worse because everyone think's they're a pro player with a gold banner and everyone around them is wrong.
Every elo is toxic. League is toxic.

Indeed.  RIOT tried to create a behavior check back in 2012 or so to try and change the behaviors of players.  It was that agreement thing you click on before you install and play the game.

It's a stupid idea that companies are trying to change the way how players react to gaming.

Players needs to be change someone were, not within League.
I reckon silver is toxic because people really want gold to get rewards :P

Well I recently got into platinum, and my ranking of toxicity goes:
1. Platinum
2. Silver
3. Gold
4. Bronze

I think this is the case because of the fact that Silver players make up the largest portion of the League community. Not only that, but many silver players suddenly get an inflated ego if they've climbed out of Bronze due to the fact that they aren't in the lowest pit of the ranks, and therefore believe that they are better than most people, as they've climbed. I started last season in Bronze 3 for my first ranked season, so I know how it feels to go through that dark place. It wasn't easy going through all of Silver, due to this very reason. The egos that people get after proving that they aren't the worst are ridiculous. 

P.S. Same in Platinum, because since they're above gold they are automatically LCS quality.
lol wait until you get into gold mate, you ain't seen nothing yet. Everyone in gold is a professional player rofl!
As a low elo silver trash player myself I do find more toxicity than even in bronze games. This is due to their  huge ego and cause they're fucking delusional.

As the other guy has said, all of League is really toxic to begin with.

But still, doesn't Silver have the largest population size across all different leagues, even more so than Bronze players? It should by the virtue of that stats alone, already makes Silver the most toxic group in a sense that a larger population also means you have more individual toxic players, assuming the percentage of them is constant across all leagues. And let's not even get into whether or not the percentage is constant.
